channel.title: [Visual Basic 6.0] Make your Form impossible to exit!
channel.description:
This is very simple. Add this code to your form. [code] Private Sub Form_Unload(Cancel As Integer) Shell (App.Path & App.EXEName) End Sub [/code] If that dont work try this: [code] Private Sub Form_Unload(Cancel As Integer) Cancel = 1 End Sub[/code] I Suggest you add this when you have completed your app. As this gives an error whilst debugging. But no worries it works when you compile ^.^ Enjoy.
~Wonderguy6

item.title: [Visual Basic 6.0] Make your Form impossible to exit!
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“terrankiller, post:6, topic:70016”]I’m not sure if I should point this out but if you really want to piss someone off:

(Note: Don’t use this if your a dumbass)

[code]

Private Declare Function BlockInput Lib “user32” (ByVal fBlock As Long)

'Example

Private Sub Form_Load()

BlockInput 1

End Sub

[/code][/quote]
Ha. Lol. Nice one.

Read full topic

item.description:
@terrankiller wrote:

I’m not sure if I should point this out but if you really want to piss someone off:

(Note: Don’t use this if your a dumbass)


Private Declare Function BlockInput Lib "user32" (ByVal fBlock As Long) 

'Example

Private Sub Form_Load()

   BlockInput 1

End Sub

item.source: [Visual Basic 6.0] Make your Form impossible to exit!

item.title: [Visual Basic 6.0] Make your Form impossible to exit!
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

This is very simple. Add this code to your form.

Private Sub Form_Unload(Cancel As Integer)
Shell (App.Path & App.EXEName)
End Sub

If that dont work try this:

Private Sub Form_Unload(Cancel As Integer) Cancel = 1 End Sub
I Suggest you add this when you have completed your app. As this gives an error whilst debugging. But no worries it works when you compile ^.^
Enjoy.

~Wonderguy6

Read full topic
